title: U.S. News: Google to Pursue Pentagon Contract, Risking Staff Ire
text:
The three-year contract replaces the 10-year, $10 billion JEDI cloud-computing contract terminated in July.

The JEDI project was mired in years of squabbling between Microsoft Corp., which won the bidding, and Amazon.com Inc., which contended the process was politically motivated under the Trump administration.

In 2018, Google came under fire from employee activists over a Pentagon contract to supply imaging tools used by drones. Several outspoken employees quit.

The company later abandoned the contract and pledged not to allow its artificial-intelligence products to be used in military weapons.
